text.0: vastospati who killest all disease and wearest every form.
text.1: be an auspicious friend to us.
text.2: when o bright son of saramā thou showest tawnyhued thy teeth.
text.3: they gleam like lances points within thy mouth when thou wouldst bite go thou to steep.
text.4: saramās son retrace thy way bark at the robber and the thief.
text.5: at indras singers barkest thou why dust thou seek to terrify us go to sleep.
text.6: be on thy guard against the boar and let the boar beware of thee.
text.7: at indras singers barkest thou why dost thou seek to terrify us go to sleep.
text.8: sleep mother let the father sleep sleep dog and master of the house.
text.9: let all the kinsmen sleep sleep all the people who are round about.
text.10: the man who sits the man who walks and whosoever looks on us.
text.11: of these we closely shut the eyes even as we closely shut this house.
text.12: the bull who hath a thousand horns who rises up from out the sea.
text.13: by him the strong and mighty one we lull and make the people sleep.
text.14: the women sleeping in the court lying without or stretched on beds.
text.15: the matrons with their odorous sweetsthese one and all we lull to sleep.
